inn1.comm: another first-ball four from Sehwag and Nagpur cheers! A touch too full from Steyn and the line is on middle, Sehwag lofts the ball over mid-on, that is some start
lbw shout from Steyn as Sehwag misses the flick but that was missing leg stump
Sehwag tries to force the ball on the leg side from the crease but gets beaten by a good length ball that pitches on middle and off and shapes away from the right-hander
good length delivery pitches outside off and seams away from the right-hander, Sehwag shoulders arms
terrific fielding at mid-off! Sehwag slammed the drive off the front foot, sending the ball rocketing over the turf, Botha dived to his left and pulled off a superb save
Sehwag feels for a good length ball outside off but gets beaten
It's Botha again! Diving to his left and tumbling to stop Tendulkar's on-the-up drive from piercing the gap between mid off and cover
banged in short outside off stump and the ball lifts sharply to van Wyk after Sehwag plays no shot.

van Wyk did not move! Dropped! Sehwag drove with feet rooted at a short of a length ball that seamed slightly away from him. Sehwag edged the cover off the ball and it flew only slightly to van Wyk's right. Maybe he didn't see for he did not move a muscle. A Kamran Akmal moment.
similar ball but this time Sehwag is more circumspect and plays no shot
Morkel's getting the ball to rise from a good length outside off. Sehwag strides forward and lifts his bat out of the way
punched off the front foot but straight to the fielder at cover
Steyn pitches the ball full, looking for outswing, Tendulkar moves forward and adjusts for that swing, pushing the ball towards mid-off

a quick single and there's an overthrow that goes for four! Tendulkar pushed the ball towards mid-off and set off. Botha swooped on the ball and fired at the bowler's end. Morkel was the man backing up and he missed it, maybe the umpire was in his way
a searing short ball at 142 kph, Sehwag sways his head out of the line of the delivery
short of a length on the pads, there's no fine leg so Sehwag lifts the ball off his hips down to the boundary, one-bounce four
Steyn's lost it here, searching for outswing from leg stump, he pitches far outside leg stump and van Wyk has no chance in saving that. There are only two men on the leg side
good length ball outside off, Sehwag plays it watchfully off the back foot towards the off

huge appeal for lbw and there's a review, is there? No there isn't. Steyn slammed a full ball into Sehwag's pads as he tried to whip across the line. What was wrong with that? That lbw appeal looked plumb, unless there was a faint edge
Tendulkar nudges a good length ball off his pads towards square leg
he over-steps and Tendulkar opens the face while square driving, angling the ball towards third man, where Kallis dives to save the boundary. Free hit coming up ...
short ball, Tendulkar moves deep into his crease to pull but mis-times it, the ball lobs towards midwicket
good length outside off and the ball takes off appreciably, Sehwag watchfully shoulders arms
a touch fuller and a lot straighter from Morkel, Sehwag stays in his crease and drives towards mid-off
short of a length outside off stump, Sehwag stands tall on the back foot and punches towards cover
Sehwag stays firm in his crease and punches another good length ball towards cover
too straight from Steyn again but he has a man in the deep now, Tendulkar flicks off his pads
defended on the back foot towards the off side
carved wide of the fielder at third man! Short and wide and Sehwag goes after it, slashing hard. Morkel dives to his right on the boundary but can't get to it. One-bounce four
short ball and much closer to the body, Sehwag drops his wrists and lets it go
a touch too straight once again, Sehwag clips the ball off his pads through square
short ball and rather straight, Tendulkar drops his wrists and sways out of the line
blitzed through cover! Sehwag stands on the back foot and crashes a length ball through cover. No body moved.
Morkel goes closer to Sehwag's body this time and seams the ball away from the right-hander. Sehwag pokes and is beaten.
too full and Sehwag has smashed it down the ground. He stayed in his crease and hammered it, Morkel bent to try and field but the ball had already screamed past
punched off the front foot towards cover
short ball outside off stump and it has disappeared as well. Sehwag uses the width and flashes hard, slashing the ball in the air past point and wide of the fielder at third man
he makes room and drives this ball in the air over point, but there's a fielder on the point boundary as well now.
good length angling into the right-hander. Sehwag goes back and punches to mid-on
the offcutter from Kallis but the line is a touch straight. Sehwag goes back and works the ball off his pads
goes back again to a fuller delivery and drives towards mid-on
short ball and Sehwag rocks back to pull it. He hasn't timed it well but there's no fielder in the deep there. The ball falls safely in the outfield and rolls to the boundary
that's far too close to cut, surely? Not for Sehwag, who backs away a touch and cuts towards third man
Tendulkar moves inside the line of the ball, and helps it around the corner, there's no short fine leg in place
good length ball and straight, played back to the bowler
too full and too straight, Sehwag stays in his crease and drives hard, placing the ball past mid-on. He simply hit through the line
and again, this time towards mid-off and this time the fielder runs to his left and slides to cut off the straight drive
Tendulkar moves forward and across to work the ball from off towards mid-on, where Peterson prevents the single
crashed through covers where even a spectacular dive can't stop the ball. Length ball outside off, Tendulkar meets the ball on the front foot and blasts it through cover
down the ground this time, the Tendulkar stamp all over that one. He moves forward to a full ball and drives dead straight. Morkel stoops in his follow through but in vain
Sehwag goes back in his crease and opens the face to steer towards third man
terrific timing and placement and the fielding is top class too. Tendulkar drives on the up, through cover point. Botha chases hard and slides and pulls the ball back in on the verge of the boundary
cut off the back foot towards third man
short ball and very straight, Tendulkar drops to his knees and sways out of the line

drama! The slower ball and Tendulkar pushes it towards mid-on and refuses the single. Wise decision from him for there's a direct hit at the bowler's end and Sehwag just put his bat in the crease in time. They run an overthrow of the ricochet
played towards third man by opening the face of the bat
a slower ball outside off, Sehwag waits for it in his crease and dabs towards third man
good length ball on off and middle, Tendulkar strides forward and defends.

pulled over deep backward square leg for six! Tendulkar was ready for the short ball and was coiled in his crease, he unleashed a powerful hook, perfectly timed and the ball flew flat over the boundary
slower ball on off stump, defended on the front foot
defended back to the bowler off the front foot
Tendulkar moves forward to a fuller ball and flicks in the air over midwicket. He didn't hit that hard nor did he time it perfectly. Morkel chases and slides in time to prevent four
fuller length on off and middle, played towards midwicket
Tendulkar moves forward, picks up the slower ball from around off stump, and whips it past mid-on, wide of the fielder
Kallis strays down leg side, that's the first extra for a while
pushed off the back foot towards point, that was a good length ball from Kallis
width outside off stump, Tendulkar moves back and across to cut the ball through cover to the fielder in the deep
short ball and Sehwag ducks under it.
straighter line and Sehwag whips it off his pads to midwicket
Tendulkar steps out to a flighted ball from round the wicket and drives towards long-off
Sehwag makes room by moving outside leg and lofts the ball inside out over cover to get to fifty, off 44 balls.
Peterson slips this one down leg side
Sehwag makes room again but Peterson follows him, Sehwag ends up playing to midwicket
pushed off the front foot towards long on for a single. Fastest team 100 of the World Cup
Tendulkar comes forward and gets beaten in the flight, he changes his shot and pushes the ball to point
another ball down the leg side, Peterson is trying to cramp the batsman
played back to the bowler off the back foot
pitches outside leg but Sehwag makes room and plays the square drive through point. Terrific placement and the carnage continues
not sure what he was trying there but Sehwag ended up edging towards third man
driven off the front foot towards long off for a single
Tendulkar moves back and across and flicks the ball off his pads through square
Sehwag plays from his crease and dabs the ball with an open face behind point
flicked off the front foot through square once again
the highlights reel continues. Tendulkar steps out to take the ball on the full and drives it powerfully past mid-on

Tendulkar goes inside out, making room and lofting the ball high over extra cover. That man de Villiers runs at top speed from long-off and dives superbly. He nearly caught it too. Terrific effort. No one else in international cricket could have got to it!

Loud appeal from Peterson and Smith reviews after the umpire says not out. He hasn't over-stepped and the ball hits the pad after Tendulkar's attempt to play across the line misses. That was missing leg stump though and Nagpur roars as the verdict is upheld.
Tendulkar gets to fifty with a nudge off his pads towards short fine leg, Sehwag ran that one quickly. He's got to 50 quicker than Sehwag did.
Sehwag tried to play on the off but got an edge on to the leg side
Sehwag waits and then punches towards long off
tapped out into deep cover, and the two isn't quite on
what's that hit, bat or pad? Tickled very fine down to fine leg, looks like it was the bat, no signal from the umpire.
eased down to long-on, and another run is added to the total
Duminy stays round the wicket, landing the ball quite wide of off but Sachin tries to whip it towards long-on all the same
lofted! Sachin has teed off, the ball goes really high and that looked like a monster hit ... but only just clears a sprinting long-on fielder! 142nd six of the tournament
crashed hard into the covers, but there's a fielder in the way of the ball

deft touch! Sehwag, who's got the cap on, stays deep in the crease and just waits and waits, tapping the ball out of the keepers gloves and down to third man. A rare gentle touch from a batsman of such violence
crunched down to long-on, just the one
Tendulkar uses his feet, getting to the pitch and squeezing the ball to long-off

how does one go about constructing a shot like this? The ball was atrocious, a real long-hop, but Sehwag stepped back and lifted it inside out off the back foot and over cover. Right between the fielders too
chopped down on the off side, but straight to point
driven down to long-off, that's nine from the over. No sign of slowing down then, despite the end of the fielding restrictions!
has that kept low? Sehwag is beaten outside off on the cut as the ball shoots under the bat

dropped? Yes, it has been! Another cut from Sehwag, this time the ball does bounce appreciably and a thick edge bounces off the outside of van Wyk's glove. A tough chance, but one he needed to take. No reaction from Botha
whipped wristily out behind square on the leg side
Tendulkar looks for the two towards midwicket, but his shot finds the close midwicket fielder
punched down to long-on this time, they settle for the one
and Sehwag follows suit with a drive down to that long-on fielder
a touch of spin, hammered out on the off side and only some very athletic fielding on the cover boundary saves four
Sachin plants the front foot down the wicket, playing across the pad to pick up a single on the leg side
quicker through the air from du Plessis, forced back to the bowler off the back foot

gone! Finally the partnership is broken. It was speared in fast and flat once again, Sehwag stepped away to make room for the cut but the ball didn't turn as much as he might have expected and he was cramped for room. Playing close to the body, he got a thin edge that smashed into the leg stump, flicking both bails into the air. Finally some relief for South Africa!
Gambhir off the mark straight away, nudging the ball out square on the leg side
Faf gives it some air and the ball seems to grip, but Tendulkar is forward and right to the pitch, driving out to the cover sweeper to keep the strike
looks to drive back down the ground, but Botha is quickly across to field
Tendulkar dances down the track this time, cracking the ball down to long-off
nice and straight from Botha, who comes round the wicket to Gambhir. Defended
big appeal! Gambhir tries to tuck to leg - it was a quicker ball - and is struck on the pad. They think about the review ... but don't. Good thinking this time, it was slipping down leg
arrowed towards leg stump again, the ball touches pad and goes down leg. Van Wyk does enough to cut it off
down the track, inside the line and lofted over cover! First boundary for Gambhir, the placement in the shot was just about perfect
Tendulkar stays deep in the crease, thrashing a cut out to the cover sweeper. There's the 150
Gambhir drives towards long-on. Du Plessis tumbles across athletically but can't cut it off, a single taken
nudged off the hip towards square leg
too short outside off, Gambhir steps back to cut and bottom-edges it right between van Wyk's legs. Steyn gives chase, and though he doesn't dive he manages to keep the ball inside the rope
down the leg side, and what has that hit? Not the bat, says Umpire Gould, as van Wyk and du Plessis appeal. Yep, off the thigh pad and then into the keeper's gloves
flicked to midwicket, and the finish the over with a sharp single
nurdled down behind square on the leg side, Gambhir hands strike back to Tendulkar
Tendulkar stays deep and just drops the ball into the gap between cover and point. Quick single taken
hurled down the leg side, the ball touches nothing on the way down so that's a wide
Botha finds a better line on off stump, Gambhir responds with a solid forward defensive
smacked out to the fielder on the deep wickwicket boundary, just the one
a touch too short from Botha, Tendulkar picks up the length early and flays it away behind point
Gambhir tries to repeat the stroke, but this time the ball is quicker and rises quite sharply off the pitch too. Point runs around to field as the ball trickles into the off side
Tendulkar takes a couple of steps down the wicket and punches down to long-off
Gambhir stays back and plays uppishly towards long-on. The ball just seemed to stop in the surface, and one hand came off the bat as he played the shot
Tendulkar gets well forward, nudging to leg but straight to the midwicket fielder
angled down but straight to backward point
held back a touch by Peterson, the ball is nicely flighted and spins away from the right-hander. Sachin is quite equal to it, however, collecting a single with a drop-and-run into the off side
whipped off the pads in front of midwicket for another single
Gambhir waits for the ball to spin, staying deep in the crease, and angles it down on the off side. There are two men behind point to stop runs there, however
too straight this time, flicked down behind square on the leg side as a result
punched away through point
Gambhir steps forward and works the ball out to deep cover with a loose-wristed drive
horrible wide, acres down the leg side. He was aiming for the quicker ball but his direction was all off
fast and flat once again, Tendulkar's cut turns into a bottom-edged chop, the ball hitting the hard surface and bouncing up, but away from the stumps
glanced behind square leg, and a single to finish the over
Peterson comes round the wicket to the right-hander, and is nudged out to midwicket for one. Full on the toes, that was, and flicked away
some turn and bounce for Peterson, and Gambhir plays it uppishly once again on the leg side. There's a man at a very close mid-on for that airy drive, but it was well placed to beat him
cracked away on the off side, deep cover cleans up
Gambhir comes down the track, he's not quite to the pitch but tries to drive out on the leg side. The ball bounces short of that man at the close straight midwicket/mid-on
flatter through the air, nothing for the batsman to work with
a touch too full, driven to long-off
after extensive field tweaks, Botha comes round the wicket and spears one at middle and leg
full and straight again, pushed back to the bowler
that looked slower through the air, Gambhir waits on it and nudges to fine leg. Not much turn for Botha, but he's getting good bounce
very full and just outside off, Tendulkar angles the ball late towards third man, but can't beat the fielder
this time he stays back in the crease and pushes the ball back to the bowler
flicked to midwicket, and straight to the fielder. End of a great over from Botha, just the single from it
driven hard into the leg side, a superb diving stop at straight midwicket stops the run
Gambhir steps back and cracks a cut out to deep cover
what was that about a dipping run rate? Tendulkar provides a boost with his third six, sailing over long-on!
on the pads, nudged to fine leg
tucked between point and backward point for one
again aimed right at leg stump, just the single as Tendulkar turns the ball to square leg
Tendulkar skips down the track but Botha spots him coming and adjusts his length, dot ball
Tendulkar wafts outside off and loses balance as he does so, but van Wyk fumbles the take ... not that costly an error though as the back foot remained grounded
a touch too short on middle and leg, nudged off the hip for one
the quicker one, and it rushes straight on! That also kept quite low, and Gambhir did well to keep it out
this time he doesn't quite hit the right length, and a cut is aimed out wide enough of the cover sweeper for them to come back for the second
driven off the front foot this time, and diving extra cover can't get a hand on the ball and so it's a single to long-off

horrible start from him, hurling the ball very wide on the off side. Gambhir was looking to attack straight away, charging the bowler, and one got the idea Steyn was trying to go wider to beat him. Just went too wide
Gambhir's blade flashes outside off, the ball goes in the air and bounces down to third man

I wonder how many runs Tendulkar has got from this shot? The ball was aimed at middle and off but from a position of perfect balance he loosens the wrists and sends it through square leg. A trademark shot
full, fast and wide of off again. Gambhir lunges into a drive but the ball bursts past the outside edge. He really threw everything at that
full again, cracked down to long-off this time
great line and length from Steyn, wobbling the ball around on off stump. Sachin searches for a single to midwicket, but it's straight to the fielder
a touch of swing again, this time the ball was a little fuller and Tendulkar leaned into a straight drive. Some footwork from Steyn saves runs, the ball rebounding off the boot and going to cover
driven into the covers, straight to the fielder
again hit into the off side, no run to be had
cracked back to the bowler this time, this is great limited-overs bowling from Botha, really pegging the batsman back
floated up much slower this time, Gambhir is forward too early and the ball pops in the air off the leading edge ... but falls well short of any fielders
shovelled out on the leg side, finally he's found a gap
great finish to the over, Tendulkar flicks straight to midwicket. South Africa need to string a few of these overs together
a wild, head-in-the-air swipe across the line from Gambhir, and unsurprisingly he gets nowhere near it. Steyn wanders down with a smile on his face to compliment him on a great shot
full and fast on the pads, he gets some bat on it to pick up a single behind square
full and straight again, that looks to have hit the pad but perhaps there was some bat involved too. The result is a single all the same
slower ball from Steyn, but Gambhir spots it, waits, and angles down to third man
wonderful exhibition of the off drive, great balance and poise ... but straight to the fielder
eased down to long-on for a single to finish the over
floated up on off stump, Tendulkar looks to collect a single to midwicket but straight to the fielder
Sachin breaks the shackles, jumping out to hammer a full toss to the cover boundary!
flicked into the leg side, midwicket sprints round to stop the run
good comeback, fast and straight and not much the batsman can do with that. Another dot
a single comes through cover point, Tendulkar playing it away on the back foot
held back a touch by Botha, but it's too short and although it spins and bounces Gambhir is in no trouble hammering the ball out to deep cover
a diving fielder on the boundary can do nothing about that! A very loose start from Du Plessis, very short indeed, and Gambhir had ages to rock back and hammer it away on the pull
spinning down the leg side this time, wide given
now the batsman charges out, meeting the ball on the full and driving down the ground
off a thick inside edge and down to fine leg
Gambhir stays deep and cuts out to deep cover
short again, but Du Plessis saved by his fielder - the man at cover dives to save
four more! Short again and rushing on to the batsman, Tendulkar rocks back and pulls in the air and straight of midwicket to beat the fielders out there
good length and straight, Gambhir tries to come forward and defends from the crease
too far down leg side, Gambhir nudges the ball off his pads through square leg
short of a length on off stump, played towards third man with an open face
fuller length on leg stump, Gambhir nudges through square once again
the bouncer and it is well directed, Tendulkar ducks under the ball
short ball once again, Tendulkar tries to paddle it down to fine leg and manages to do so, but only after getting both bat and body on it
defended on the front foot, wicket to wicket line from Duminy from round the wicket
Gambhir charges and lofts the ball over extra cover, splitting the gap between deep cover and long off

Duminy strays down leg side and Gambhir plays a fine paddle, du Plessis chases after it and dives head first to try and save the boundary. He doesn't and then crashes into the thick advertisement hoardings. The electronic ones. Careful man!
played on the leg side for a single
short ball and Tendulkar pulls, the crowd screams in unison as they think it's a four. It isn't.
nudged on the off side, Gambhir begins to run and then sees Tendulkar isn't interested
Tendulkar drops a good length ball short on the off side and runs, Gambhir says no
Tendulkar flicks and flicks fluently. A flying Faf soars to his left at midwicket to cut it off
Tendulkar moves towards the off and cuts a short of a length ball hard into the ground. The fielder at backward point collects it above his head
Tendulkar goes deep into his crease and works the ball off his hips through square, on 98 now.
Gambhir pushes a good length ball on the off side, he's nearing his fifty too
worked off the pads towards deep backward square
good length ball angling into the left-hander from round the wicket. Gambhir defends on the off side and look at Tendulkar run. Absolutely sprinted through
Tendulkar strides forward and drives through cover point to move on to 99, one short of his 99th international century
Gambhir uses the width outside off to glide towards third man
fuller ball on middle stump, Tendulkar dabs on the leg side ... a momentary hush at the dot ball before the din begins again
I wish you could listen to that, as Tendulkar drove a length ball towards deep cover ... he takes off his helmet to acknowledge the fervent cheers ... international century No. 99.
Gambhir gets to his half-century by dabbing behind square, the crowd cheer again. There's a sudden rise in tempo in Nagpur ...
the slower ball wide outside off stump, Gambhir stays on the back foot and flays his bat at it. He misses
length ball and Gambhir has launched it, off the front foot, over wide long-on, one-bounce four ... clean strike, lovely follow through
dabbed off the back foot towards point, Tendulkar doesn't want the single
another slower ball, Gambhir pulls and tries to hit it too hard. The shot is mis-timed towards midwicket
pitches on leg stump and Gambhir is able to tuck it off his pads through square leg
Tendulkar moves right across his stumps, outside off even, to flick a ball from off towards deep square leg. Risky shot, but he's in such control
Tendulkar charges and mis-times the ball in the air through midwicket, it's in the air but just wide of the fielder
tight line and length from Morkel on middle, played towards midwicket
length ball outside off stump and Tendulkar dismisses it. Dismisses it with a powerful slap of his bat off the front foot. He connected that at chest height
another flat-batted smash through point, Amla has to scurry to his right on the deep point boundary and save it
Tendulkar makes room and chips it in the air towards third man, he chipped that from in front of his stumps
driven towards deep point for a single
short of a length and Gambhir backs away to make room and slaps the ball towards mid-on. It falls short of the fielder

Gambhir plays the ball to midwicket and sets off for a risky single. He would have been out if the ball had hit direct at the bowler's end. They try an overthrow and this time Tendulkar would have been out had there been a direct hit at the bowler's end
chipped down to third man for a single
the slower ball and it keeps a touch low, Tendulkar pushes the ball towards square leg and sets off, there's a fumble from the fielder
Gambhir backs away to make room and biffs the ball towards mid-off ... Steyn's bowled an excellent over so far
the slower bouncer and Tendulkar tries to slash it, or something, and misses. Steyn thinks he's nicked it and the keeper appeals very late. They aren't asking for a review though
Gambhir makes room by backing away and uses the width to slash the ball hard to the point boundary. That flew across the turf ...
Gambhir moves towards the off, gets under a full ball, and hoists it high towards wide long-on where it bounces once before going over the boundary
Gambhir moves across his stumps to try and paddle the ball on the leg, he misses and gets hit on the pad. Morkel appeals but it was missing off stump

caught at point! Tendulkar tried to clear his front leg and smash the ball down the ground, but he didn't make proper contact, slicing it high in the air towards point, where Duminy took a few steps back and held the catch.
Gambhir runs away towards square leg and tries to slash through the off, gets beaten
Gambhir backs away again, and drives the ball from his stumps through cover point

caught at mid-off! Are India slipping again? Gambhir backs away to a slower ball, and is foxed by the change of pace. He ends up chipping it in the air towards Kallis, who takes a sharp catch diving forward
Yusuf defends on the front foot ...

South Africa on fire as Yusuf is caught at cover. Yusuf stood in his crease and just threw his bat at a length delivery, he sliced it in the air towards cover, where Smith took the catch over his head on the edge of the circle
short of a length ball rises on Dhoni who fends on the leg side and runs
whipped off the pads through square leg
Dhoni tries to glance the ball down leg side but makes improper contact
Yuvraj welcomes him with a big wind up and a powerful swing, smashing the ball straight down the ground for a clean six
cut hard off the back foot, can't beat the fielder

Yuvraj misses the sweep against a full ball and gets struck on the boot, he falls over after playing the shot. Botha appeals and the umpire says not out. Smith wants a review. The replays show that Yuvraj smashed the ball with the bat on to the boot.
played towards long on for a single, but Dhoni runs so quickly that they come back for two
punched down the ground towards long off
Dhoni lunges forward to nurdle the ball towards short third man
full ball on off stump, punched past the bowler for a single
full ball on middle stump, driven firmly towards mid-on
pushed down the ground for a single this time
Yuvraj makes room and swings a length ball towards deep square leg
Dhoni plays an ugly slog across the line to hit a full ball towards midwicket

Yuvraj holes out to long-on off a full toss, would you believe it. South Africa are thrilled. It was a friendly full toss and Yuvraj wanted to clear the boundary, he got plenty of height on it but no distance. It falls into Botha's hands on the boundary. Epic fightback by South Africa.
played off the back foot towards wide mid-on.
muscled off the back foot towards long on
a perfect forward defence towards the bowler
short ball on leg stump, pulled towards deep square leg
it looked like Virat got an edge as he tried to force it off the back foot but van Wyk failed to hold on
bizarre batting, Virat pushes the ball gently back to Peterson, a easy caught and bowled. South Africa are right back in this. Peterson flings the ball in celebration and they are pumped.
played off the back foot towards cover
Dhoni goes back and foreces the ball towards cover point
cut off the back foot towards third man
the slower ball on off stump, Harbhajan pushes towards cover
short of a length ball over middle stump, Harbhajan tries to swat it but misses.
Harbhajan pushes forward and gets a thick edge towards third man
pushed gently off the front foot towards cover
flighted delivery on off and middle, driven towards long off
Peterson draws Dhoni into a tentative prod and spins the ball past the bat
a flatter and quicker ball, Dhoni hits it off the back foot towards long on
Harbhajan charges and swats the ball down to long on
nudged off the pads through square leg
flashed hard off the back foot towards cover, it doesn't get past the circle
Dhoni tries to force the ball off the back foot but Smith runs from cover towards silly mid off to prevent the run
played off the back foot towards long on for a single
the slower ball and Harbhajan swings helplessly, the ball passed miles under the bat. India are plummeting here.

bowled him! India continue to crash and burn. Harbhajan backs away and swings aimlessly. Steyn had bowled a dead straight yorker. Middle stump takes a hit. 320 is par on this pitch, will India get that much?
another yorker, and Zaheer plays it to third man. One run off that over. Will India limp to even 300?
Dhoni goes back and plays it back to the bowler. Nudge and nurdle, push and proddle seems to be his game.
pulled off the back foot through midwicket
Zaheer defends towards cover, Smith charges in to field. They are intense.

the implosion continues! Morne Morkel you beauty. He runs across to his right, covering lots of ground, slides and takes a superbly-judged catch. Zaheer had come forward and tried to clear the wide long-on boundary
pushed on the leg side for a single and Dhoni takes a single. Surely he should be trying to force the pace? Or take strike?
Peterson turns the ball past the outside edge of Nehra's defence
length ball outside off and Dhoni cuts towards deep point. South Africa will take that, Nehra has to face Steyn ...
Nehra stands in his crease and pushes a short of a length ball towards point
another one falls! Nehra drives a full ball straight at Smith at cover. There is a sense of bewilderment in Nagpur. India were 267 for 1 ... they are 296 for 9 now.
bowled him! Steyn takes five as India have imploded in the most spectacular fashion. A full and fast delivery does for Munaf. The stumps take another hit.

inn2.comm: good start from Zaheer, swing straight away back into the right-hander, who nudges into the leg side. Someone wanted a single there, confusion though and there was never one on. Smith is quickly sent back
shot! This one didn't swing, or not nearly as much, and Amla stood tall to punch it with power and elegance to the cover boundary
slanting across the right-hander once again, this lands well outside off and goes further though. No need to play at that
Zak finds his line, aiming at the off stump. Amla is rock solid in defence
well, that was anything but solid! Zaheer gives him width again and Amla just flings the bat out at it wildly, aiming to go through - or over - the off side. An airy waft, and a play-and-miss
back to defence to finish the over, as Zaheer goes full and straight
width from Nehra, Smith gets across and slaps straight to point, on the bounce
this one hits the seam and comes back in to the left-hander, who tucks to square leg this time. Smith is going hard at the ball here
chopped very hard into the ground, Yuvraj leaps at point  but the ball bounces over him, and they're back for the second as third man runs round
fuller this time, aimed at the pads. Smith sets himself for the glance but ball beats bat and strikes pad
too short, and with a total lack of venom. Not sure what the plan was, but that was a pretty feeble attempt at a bouncer, and Smith is in no trouble hammering a muscle-bound pull out to midwicket
tapped down to third man, a single to finish the over
Zaheer is getting it to go both ways, this one snakes in through the air and is heading for middle and off - before Smith's heavy bat comes down in defence
fuller and straighter this time, Smith aims a flick towards midwicket but hits the field
resounding crack off the bat as Smith leans forward to drive a very full ball outside off, the ball is hit straight into the ground and bounces up to Kohli at cover. The crowd think it's a catch!
has that kept low? Perhaps just a touch. It was nice and straight too, but Smith jabs down in defence in good time
Smith looks almost like Shane Watson in mirror-image here as he steps forward and chop-cuts, but straight to point
punched just straight of mid-on, and there's room for them to steal a single. Smith keeps strike
full, slipping into the pads, and flicked just behind square leg. Doesn't have the power to reach the boundary though
nipping back in to the batsman, that has moved appreciably and was zeroing in on Smith's middle stump. He's watching it closely, though, and defends wide-eyed to leg
full again, this time outside off and Smith presents the full face of the bat as he defends to mid-off
well, the width was there but Smith just tried to smash this too hard. His bottom hand took over completely and the ball went nowhere, trickling into the covers
slower through the air from Nehra, and he finds a touch of swing in to the left-hander. Smith slices across the ball and gets it down to third man
Amla really nails these backfoot drives, as he does now, but Yusuf Pathan gets in the way of the shot at cover. Saved four there
full and straight, a cautious Smith defends towards mid-on
back-of-a-length and rising towards the hip, nudged down to fine leg
Amla punches through the line on the drive, but the ball just left him off the seam and a very thick edge flies down to third man
hooping into Smith's famously 'big' pads, he usually thumps those away with ease but this time the ball nips past the bat and hits the pad. Definitely going down leg
Smith walks down at Khan but then tries a cute dab to third man, the bowler had re-adjusted his length when he saw him coming and the ball zips past the outside edge
punched firmly, but without much timing, to mid-on

Smith is struggling to middle it but Amla is really finding the middle here - but he also keeps picking out the fielders! This time he aims a cracking drive into the covers but straight to a man in blue
punched off the back foot, this time it's straight at Yusuf, who flings the ball at the non-striker's stumps. Smith is easily home, and the throw is wide
slashed over gully! He was offered width and went for it, a third or fourth slip might've been interested, but there isn't one and the ball beats third man too

Amla leans forward and drives again, this time threading the gap at cover ... a fielder is after it, it's Tendulkar and that's quite an effort for a 37-year-old, he chases it all the way and dives ... but can't quite haul it in
Nehra pulls the length back, punched into the covers
pushed towards mid-off, who is deep, and a single to finish the over
drop-and-run from Amla, he taps the ball towards mid-off and they set off. I think Munaf is the fielder there ...
Smith is struggling to get the ball off the square, now he walks down once again and Zaheer cuts one off the seam to strike the pad
full and straight, Smith brings the bat down in an arc that sends it towards midwicket, straight to the fielder
and again, what's happened to Smith's bread-and-butter shot off his pads? He walks down the wicket, Zaheer aims at the pad and he can't lay anything on it. One off the pad
was that slower? It was certainly a cutter. Amla waited on the ball, guiding it down to third man
a touch of wobble through the air, the ball aimed right at middle, and Smith brings his bat down dead-straight in defence
slower again, dinked to point. It looks like this pitch has really slowed up under lights
pushed to mid-off, again there's no run to be had
Nehra's bowling nice and straight in this over, Amla has no room to work with and so can only push to mid-off again
offcutter by the left-arm seamer, the ball lands and nips away from Amla, who was trying to run it down to third man but is beaten
pitched up outside off, Amla steps forward and deliberately lifts it over cover. Cracking shot, power and placement
Nehra re-adjusts, but too much - it's on Amla's pads and he whips confidently to the square leg boundary
Smith simply doesn't have a clue against Zaheer Khan - at least not in these conditions. Again he charges the bowler but then swipes with no great certainty, the ball hits pad and loops towards gully
just a hint of desperation in that shot! Smith aims down the ground with the lofted drive, he doesn't get all of it but gets enough to beat mid-off and find the boundary

gone! Pitched up, Smith's eyes light up and he launches into a drive but hits it straight to Tendulkar at mid-off. Khan gets Smith once again, he's well and truly won this battle. An early breakthrough - just what India wanted!
a brave leave from Kallis! He steps forward and raises the bat high above his head, but that's not missed off stump by more than a couple of inches
Kallis steps forward and drives hard to mid-off
tight end to the over from Khan, he's been outstanding with the new ball and once again zones in on the stumps to draw a defensive stroke from Kallis
Amla walks down the wicket and across to the off side, but Munaf adjusts his length and a rising ball is tapped to midwicket
fuller, outside off and Amla steps into a fluid drive - but straight to the fielder
definite seam movement for Munaf, away from the bat, but Amla isn't troubled as he runs it down to third man
back-of-a-length, Kallis stands at the crease and punches to cover. This really doesn't look like the easiest wicket to start on, definitely getting slower
Munaf strays onto leg stump and Kallis gets across to flick to fine leg, the ball goes straight to the man at 45
the ball dies off the pitch, nipping under the bat as once again the batsman tries to force it away through the off side. No edge though, and if there had been one it wouldn't have reached the keeper
a touch of extra bounce, but he rides it well, taking a hand off the bat and getting the ball down to third man
on a length and straight, pushed into the leg side
landing on off stump, the ball seams away off the pitch and Amla stands up to crack it to cover
Nehra has generally been good today, and he's keeping Kallis quiet here. More defence
there's a single, finally, into the covers
but he's tight on the stumps to end the over, no run there
Kallis leans into a very Kallis-esque drive, standing tall and leading with the left elbow, but the ball goes straight to cover
pitched up again, another drive and this time it's to mid-off
Munaf keeps it full, and Kallis is content to bide his time, pushing to cover
now he tries to manufacture something, walking down and across to off. He flicks to midwicket's left, the fielder gets a hand to it but they taje a single
again the ball dies off the pitch, squeezing under the bat as Amla tries to run it down to third man
this time it behaves, and Amla connects with the glide to third man
rising off a length on a leg stump line, Amla glances out to long leg. They're back for the second and that brings up South Africa's 50
driven towards mid-off, the timing is not great and so they've got time to sneak through for one
another languid, aesthetically-pleasing drive from Kallis, but straight to cover
the ball angles towards off stump but Kallis whips across the line to pick the gap at square leg. Gap in the circle that is, as there's a man out on the boundary there
great line, more than anything else, from Nehra as he lands one on off stump and beats the outside edge of the bat. It's kept low too, getting to the keeper on the bounce
Amla steps a foot across to off stump and flicks with springy wrists out to deep square leg
superb fielding! Amla punches towards mid-off and sets off, Kohli stops the ball and hurls it at the stumps in one fluid movement ... it misses by a whisker! Amla was gone if that had hit
angled down to third man
good length, but outside off and Amla aims a deft little late cut down to third man ... Tendulkar sprints across and cuts it off, stopping the second run

South Africa needed a boundary, there it is! But that could easily have been a wicket too, Kallis thrashed a drive in the air and just over a salmon-leaping Kohli in the covers. Just past the outstretched fingers
another booming drive from Kallis, but he finds cover point. It's not stopped cleanly, so they get a single
forced away off the back foot, again it's intercepted in the ring but not quickly enough to stop a cheeky single
Amla walks to the off side but Nehra follows him, going well wide of off. Amla responds with a drive, but can't beat Kohli at mid-off, who is having a great time in the field tonight. Just a single
glanced off the pads and out towards deep square leg, they're back for the second
Kohli is in the right position here - another punch off the back foot and he's the man well-positioned to stop it
full and straight, Kallis bends into a straight drive but can't time it
back of a length, outside off and rising. Kallis aims a punch to cover, but again there's no timing in the shot
driven hard at mid-off, somehow there's time for a single there. The fielder is too deep
good length ball outside off stump, Kallis tries to square drive but gets a thick edge towards third man
Amla moves outside off stump and guides another good length ball towards third man
Kallis comes down again to drive and gets a thick edge towards third man
nudged towards mid on for a quick single, they complete it before Harbhajan releases his throw
played off the back foot on the leg side
played off the front foot towards mid-on
flat and short ball, Amla moves across his stumps to play behind square
short again outside off stump, cut towards deep point
a flat ball skids and turns into Kallis who got hit on the pad before he could bring his bat down, going down leg though
played off the pads behind square, moved across his stumps a lot
a flat ball on middle stump on a dilly-dobbler's length, played through square
another ball worked through square leg for a single
good length ball on off stump, driven off the front foot towards mid-off
Kallis walks forward and towards the off to whip a length ball from off towards deep square
length ball on off, driven off the back foot through cover point
Raina's on the field for ... I'll confirm shortly. So South Africa's batsmen can't simply punch to mid-off and run, like they did when Munaf or Zaheer was there
Kallis carves the ball over cover but to the fielder in the deep, flamboyant shot for one run
Amla strides forward and flicks through midwicket with lost of wrist power
Amla goes back to cut a flat ball outside off and misses
Amla moves forward and flicks the ball towards deep square, and the moment they realise it's Munaf Patel on the boundary they call for the second
flicked towards deep square again for a single this time
driven off the front foot toward wide long-off
Amla moves right across once again and flicks through square
too straight from Yusuf and Kallis pushes the ball through midwicket for a single
flighted delivery from round the wicket, driven firmly towards cover where Kohli half stops the ball
fuller and faster, dug out on the off side
Yuvraj angles the ball into the right-hander, Kallis strides forward and blocks
driven off the front foot towards long-off
short ball and Amla cuts off the back foot towards deep point
short once again, Kallis punches through cover point. Five easy runs off that over
pushed down the ground for a single
Amla moves forward and across to nudge towards the leg but doesn't make proper contact
Amla moves forward and flicks the ball through midwicket, to bring up the 50 partnership
played through square for a single
played in front of square for one
Kallis moves across his stumps and works the ball towards midwicket
too short and Amla cuts to short third man where Tendulkar fields to prevent the single
Amla drives towards cover, where Kohli fields
Amla leans forward and plays the ball towards long on
driven to Munaf on the deep cover boundary, two for the taking when it is played to him.
played towards long off for a single
Amla gets to 50 by slapping a short ball through cover
Amla goes back in his crease to flick the ball to deep square
Kallis moves right across his stumps and plays the ball fine to bring up South Africa's century
pushed on the off side for a single
played on the off side from the crease
fired down leg side, Amla clips the ball behind square for a single
there's a leg gully in place now and Kallis glances the ball off the pads past him
flat ball on middle and leg, flicked through square
Amla jumps down the track and defends the ball towards the bowler
Amla drives a full ball past the bowler, Harbhjan could have made a better effort to field that
tossed up outside off stump, defended on the front foot
played off the back foot through square leg
played towards point off the back foot
Amla drives fluently off the front foot through cover. Singles are easy to get at the moment.
tossed up on middle stump, Kallis drives off the front foot and beats the fielder at cover
played towards long off for one more
Kallis drives again on the front foot, driven to cover
and out of the blue, Kallis gets down on one knee, picks up the ball from outside off, and sweeps powerfully to the deep square leg boundary
played on the leg side from the crease
and the score ticks over again, they are doing this calmly
goes on the back foot and works it off the pads towards square
Amla strides forward and drives towards cover, where Sehwag dives to cut it off

dropped? Amla flicked the ball off the front foot in the air towards midwicket, Yuvraj moved to his left to take it and the ball arrived at head height slightly towards his left, he got his hands to it but let it go through. Regulation chance.
the reverse sweep and Tendulkar has a bit of work to do to keep it to one
driven firmly back towards the bowler
played through point for a single
Amla charges and lofts the ball over extra cover towards wide long off
Kallis moves across and paddles the ball fine
played off the back foot towards midwicket
Kallis gets down low and paddles the ball from off towards fine leg
another single towards Tendulkar, he's had a lot of running to do

caught behind! There was some extra bounce on that and a bit of turn into Amla, who shaped to cut and was cramped for room. The ball got big on him and the edge was taken sharply. Dhoni flings the ball high in the air in celebration
AB gets off the mark by moving back and punching to long on
Kallis tries to nudge the ball on the leg but gets some glove on it
flighted delivery on off stump, played on the leg side
Kallis gets to his half-century by playing one on the off side towards point, South Africa need him to stay a lot longer
AB moves a touch forward and taps the ball towards midwicket
Kallis waits in his crease and guides the ball towards third man
AB makes a bit of room and glances the ball towards third man with an open face
Kallis walks forward and across and flicks crisply towards midwicket
Kallis moves forward and taps the ball gently to Tendulkar at mid on, running as he completes the shot
AB drives the ball fluently through cover for a single
AB fishes out the reverse paddle and plays the ball through point

what happened there? Kallis went right across his stumps, exposing all three while trying to make contact with the sweep. The ball hit his glove, thigh and a few other things and the ball went past off stump and the keeper
appeal for lbw but the impact was outside off
Kallis plays the reverse sweep but can't beat Tendulkar who dives to his right at short third man
the conventional sweep this time and Kallis makes awesome contact, hitting the ball hard and flat through square leg.
Kallis is playing the scoop? And rather well too, he gets down low, outside off and lifts the ball fine towards the fine-leg boundary. A lumbering Zaheer has no chance.
short ball hit hard towards deep point
Kallis drives powerfully off the front foot but can't beat cover
swept firmly on the full but there's a fielder at deep square
played towards point for a single
Kallis drives with a flourish, but can't place the ball past cover
pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
AB charges, AB gets to the pitch of the ball, and with a golf swing he sends the ball soaring over midwicket, huge hit
AB charges again and hits the ball to the bowler
stays on the back foot this time and plays towards square leg
Kallis moves forward and nudges the ball off his pads behind square
pushed back to the bowler on the front foot, Harbhajan is talking to AB
AB charges again and swats the ball towards deep midwicket, the ball falls short of the man in the deep. More lip from Harbhajan
AB goes on the back foot and cuts the ball towards deep point
tries to paddle but a top edge falls safely and goes towards fine leg
Kallis gets hit on the pad after missing the sweep but the impact was outside off
hit hard on the back foot towards cover where Kohli dives to his left to make a superb save, he gets up quickly and fires the throw to Dhoni
Yuvraj spins the ball sharply across AB who prodded off the back foot
driven off the front foot through cover for a single
Zaheer goes round the wicket, hits a good length and shapes the ball away, AB swishes and misses
AB stays firm in his crease and punches a delivery angling into him towards cover
the slower ball outside off stump, the ball arrived after AB had finished playing the cut
AB tries to force the ball through the off side but the room to cut is scarce and he inside edges on to his leg
Kallis plays the ball back to Zaheer who jumps up to field and parries the ball towards cover
another slower ball outside off and it keeps a touch low as well, Kallis is beaten on the cut
dangerous shot from AB, exposing his stumps and hanging the bat out. He's looking for the quick single into the covers but doesn't place it
one bounce over exta cover! Great shot, he seized on a long half volley outside off and committed fully to the shot
this time he's down the track, and flicks into the deep at midwicket ... hard running brings two
AB uses his feet again, but Yuvraj adjusts his length and also floats it up ... the ball grips and spins and a  bit of a leading edge goes towards mid-off
this time he stays at the crease, cracking it out to deep cover
full and on the toes, nudged in front of midwicket for one
full and straight, Kallis digs it out towards mid-on and they've got time to sprint through for one
Zaheer stays round the wicket, offers up some width outside off and AB thrashes a cut out to deep cover. Played off the front foot, that was

They're going for a review here. Kallis walked down and across to off and was struck on the pad, Zaheer wanted it straight away. It pitches inline, would've hit off but he's more than 2.5 metres down. Some part of the ball needs to be hitting middle if that is the case, so Kallis survives! That was mighty close

a great bouncer from Khan, Kallis whips it away from in front of his nose and out into the deep ... they come back for the second but the throw is good and the bails are whipped off in a flash ... he's gone! What terrific work from Dhoni, he took the ball in front of the stumps from Harbhajan's throw and swivelled round in mid-air to catch Kallis short. Pressure on South Africa's middle order!
good ball to start, nice and full on off stump. Dug out back to the bowler
and again! No great pace but the yorker is pinpoint and the best Duminy can do is dig it out. Zaheer walks down and offers a lingering, dismissive smile at the batsman
full of length and slanting towards off, de Villiers cracks it to mid-off and hares off for a single

shot! Duminy has walked out into an intensely-pressurised situation but he's shown great composure to pick up the line and length early and open the face on the latest of late cuts down to the third man boundary
swinging in through the air, on a length again, but no width to work with this time, dot ball
chopped down to gully, how was there a single there? Yuvraj was in position but de Villiers is so quick, even though the throw is sharp he was back in time. Greased lightning
inside edge! de Villiers was aiming for the pick-up sweep over square leg, the edge flew between legs and wicket as he stepped away and beat a diving Dhoni
same shot, different result! Again he backs away, looking to scoop the ball to long leg but this time the ball zips right past him - and not far from the leg stump - through to Dhoni
full, curving in towards leg stump. Duminy gets some pad on it and AB calls him through
AB was a foot outside leg before Khan had even reached the crease, the bowler aims for the leg stump and he's swiped across the line to square leg
superb ball, swinging in and the only thing that's saved Duminy from being plumb lbw was a little inside edge
full toss outside off, slammed down the ground but excellent, diving stop from Harbhajan saves the boundary! Great commitment, and they've only come back for two

yorker, dug out to the mid-on fielder and they take him on ... fumbled! Who was that? Munaf it is, and he's let them through for one. To be fair, they were always going to try for the single, but he could've done better there
Zaheer hits the seam, the ball jags back in and leaps off a length to beat Duminy's attempted whip to leg ... but de Villiers calls him through all the same, great running
nudged off the hip into the leg side

de Villiers sets himself for a big shot, slamming the ball down the ground ... well, theoretically that's a caught-and-bowled chance, but it was hit really hard. Went right through Munaf's legs. de Villiers ran halfway down before he remembered he had a runner
Duminy jumps out and slashes over a leaping point fielder!
full on leg stump, Duminy aims an almighty heave over square leg but the ball takes him on the boot ... and they run a leg bye
full toss on middle and leg, de Villiers lifts it over wide mid-on and that's four!
head-in-the-air slog from de Villiers, who steps away to leg. He doesn't get anywhere near the ball, which was on a length and shoots past leg stump
what a yorker! Swerving in towards middle, Duminy jabs down and gets a thick inside edge on it

what on earth kind of shot is that? It defies description ... he set himself for the reverse sweep, but the ball appeared to hit the back of the bat and flew down to fine leg. Still, a boundary is a boundary
four more, sliced over backward point! That was too full and too wide, it was always going to invite a big shot and he's got no cover there during the powerplay
full toss on middle and off, cracked down to long-off

down the ground, over the bowler's head, that's six! It was a slower ball from Khan, picked by Duminy and he lofted it dead straight down the ground. At first it didn't even look like he'd got all of that, but it crashed straight into the sightscreen
yorker, snaking in towards off stump but not quite straight enough and Duminy jabs it out through point
landing on middle, Duminy skips down and whips out to midwicket

shot! de Villiers is playing some superbly attacking, innovative cricket here. Harbhajan came round the wicket, landed a quicker ball on middle and leg and de Villiers was into position in a flash, lifting the ball over the man at short third man. There's his fifty

but he's gone now! It was the orthodox slog sweep this time, he cracked it right out of the middle but didn't get much height in the shot. Kohli dived forward at square to hold the catch above the turf, and Harbhajan waves AB back to the pavilion. India back in the game
cut down straight to backward point
full on middle, eased down to long on
tapped softly towards midwicket, they immediately set off for a quick single
quick through the air from round the wicket, Faf drops it towards point, no run
held back by Yuvraj, looped up on middle, Du Plessis can't get it away
flicked to midwicket, there's the single finally
tucked off his pads, quick single taken
too short, Du Plessis rocks back and pulls out to wide long-on ... Munaf isn't the quickest in the field out there, so they're back for the second
over long-off! Du Plessis was under such pressure straight away, but he's backed his own ability here, stepping down the wicket and slapping the drive over the fielder on the boundary
Duminy shuffles out, Harbhajan spots him and really holds it back slower and shorter, but they still get the single down to long on
clipped just wide of short fine leg
reverse sweep from Duminy, he nails it really hard and along the ground but straight to Yusuf

Duminy falls ... eventually! He charged out again, was beaten as the ball was speared down the leg side. Dhoni fumbled the take, and Duminy, who was several metres down, started back for the crease. Dhoni quickly recovered, picking the ball up and whipping the bails off with the batsman short
he bends into a sweep first ball, but is beaten by a bit of spin and a lot of bounce, the ball spitting over leg stump
late cut from van Wyk, but not quite fine enough to beat the fielder
turned round to short fine leg, they take on the fielder and get one
he charges Munaf, getting a great connection on a thumping drive, but aiming it straight at the fielder
slashed down to third man, Tendulkar gets across to cut it off

dropped by Gambhir at long leg! Van Wyk slog swept in the air, the ball looped towards Gambhir but he over-ran it and also slipped as he stooped to attempt the catch ... and the ball rolls past him to the boundary!
off the pad, the ball rolls into the leg side and they take one
tapped to leg again, brave running as they take on the fielder

There's a review, but van Wyk looked stone dead here. He tried to reverse sweep a very full delivery, and was hit on the front pad ... the finger goes up for the second time, he's gone! Replays suggest it would've clipped leg - it was left to the on-field call. If he'd been given not out that decision would have stood too, but that wasn't the case so he's got to go
Harbhajan comes round the wicket to Du Plessis, who flicks across his front pad to get the ball down to fine leg
full, whipped hard but a diving midwicket fielder gets a hand to it
cracked out to deep square leg
quicker one! Full on middle, dug out to the off side
nudged off the toes, that brings up the 250 with a single
what's happened there? It looked like the ball had snuck through, but Dhoni couldn't stop it cleanly and they stole a quick single
Munaf attacks the stumps, full and straight, and Botha offers a forward defensive back to the bowler. No big shot ... yet!
short, wide and slow from Munaf, that deserved to be put away and Botha slapped the cut shot with perfect precision. He's got a field that he's got to bowl straight to, but that was very wide indeed
nudged down to long-on ... somehow they're back for the second! Where was the fielder?
chipped up and over the off side, towards long-off. Landing in no-man's land
Du Plessis steps across to off and places the ball to midwicket ... it's between the fielders so they're back for the second
flicked towards midwicket again, will they push for two? Nope, they don't risk it, just the one this time
dropped down close on the leg side, quick single. Harbhajan still coming round the wicket
quick and flat on leg stump, clipped out to long leg
down the wicket to try and get to the pitch, he almost yorks himself in the process but lays enough on it to get the ball down to long-off
Botha lines up a huge slog sweep, but the eyes were closed on that one and he can't get anything on it
wow, how did that miss off stump? Botha swings across the line, a quicker ball skids on and almost shaves the off stump. So close!
full toss outside off, he's driven hard and just wide of long-off, they're back for two

atrocious delivery, a high full toss way outside off - it would've been a wide if he hadn't slapped it out to deep cover. Du Plessis rues not getting a better connection on that, it was there to be hit
full outside off, driven wide of long-off and that's two more

swung away on the leg side, it was hit hard and beat a diving midwicket fielder ... Kohli charged across on the boundary and put in a great dive, getting a hand to it but it's not enough to stop the boundary
on a length and straight, that's where Botha wanted it and he heaves through the line to send the ball sailing straight back over the bowler's head. Six runs!

and then a wicket! Botha had just hit two boundaries and he wanted a third, swinging really hard but the ball swirled up off the top edge over the covers ... Suresh Raina, the substitute fielder, runs across and holds a great catch, the ball coming from behind him. Another one goes, and the match continues to hang in the balance!
Faf skips out of his crease and drives down to long on, one run the result and South Africa now want 17 from 12
Du Plessis uses his feet but the ball is speared at his toes, dug out on the leg side

confusion, confusion! Peterson digs out to the off side, Du Plessis sets off but he goes nowhere ... the cover fielder picks up and throws to Zaheer, fortunately for the batsman the throw is not great, Zaheer collects and knocks the bails off but Peterson is home. Tense stuff!
another yorker, great bowling. This one is dug out to cover point
Peterson walks down, Zaheer slips in a full, fast yorker well wide of off, and it slips under the bat! Another dot ball, the crowd are cheering each one!
good shot, hammered out into the off side but straight to the cover sweeper

Du Plessis misses out on a juicy full toss! That was there to be hit, he jumped out of his crease but just tried to smash it too hard. His head was in the air, he was off balance. He could've hit that on either side of the wicket but doesn't lay bat on it.
huge swipe, Peterson was aiming for the stratosphere there but a thick inside edge shot past the stumps and Dhoni and down to fine leg. That's so unlucky for the bowler!
six runs! Peterson was walloped the leather off this one, sending the ball sailing over cow corner. His team-mates are whooping and cheering in the changing room!
inswinging yorker in the blockhole! But he jams down on it, the ball rolls down to fine leg and they push really hard for the second ... scores level! Direct hit but Peterson slides home in time
there's the game! Peterson steps away and slams it through the covers, roaring with delight as the ball threads the gap and races away
